== General ==
Ubuntu Touch Developer is currently running on the devices listed below.

Images are currently built in the Canonical data center and they are based on `quantal`. Over the next days all necessary changes for Ubuntu Touch are going to go into Ubuntu `raring` and images will be built using `raring` as a basis. They are published on `cdimages.ubuntu.com`.

Currently the images are built from an internal Jenkins instance and are manually copied to cdimages.ubuntu.com. In the next few days, we'll be working on moving away from this internal instance and fully automate the build process.

=== Adding your image ===

If you have any questions about the images or would like to get images added, <nowiki>[[..-Contribute#Discuss|ask us on the mailing list]]</nowiki>. The more specific you can be about how your image is put together, the better. In the beginning you might want to add your image below to the ''Work in progress'' section.

<nowiki>[[..-Porting|Read the porting guide >]]</nowiki>

A few points to bear in mind are:
* add your contact details - Launchpad page or email address both work
* if you upload an image or code, bear in mind that many might be interested in it, so make sure the quality of the image is good and that it is hosted in a place that can withstand a potential surge of visitors
* announce it <nowiki>[[..-Contribute#Discuss|on the mailing list]]</nowiki>

== Working, but not available from cdimage.ubuntu.com ==
'''The following devices have been contributed by a variety of Ubuntu Touch lovers. They however do not live on cdimage.ubuntu.com and don'T work with `phablet-flash`.''' This is due to three primary reasons:
* Redistributability: For every bit of firmware we need to know that we are absolutely allowed to redistribute it through its license.
* We need to know which code changes need to be done and they need to be integrated.
* We need to be able to create the image easily.

Apart from that a few things in the infrastructure need to still be figured out, but it'd be fantastic if we can get this done together.

Some notes:
